answerText: metastable state [or metastable energy level][10] A metastable nuclear isomer of this element has an unusually long half-life of 6 hours and relaxes to the ground state by emitting gamma rays with energies of 143 KeV, which makes it very useful for medical imaging.
heading: PADAWAN |2014 | 11 | 11 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Three-level laser systems are only made possible by exploiting this state for the upper energy level, so that decay by spontaneous emission is very rare. [10] Name this type of state that does not have the least energy but is nonetheless a state in which a system can exist for a "long" time.
